content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Central Water Catchment" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(February 2025)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*Planning Area in North Region, Singapore The **Central Water Catchment**, also known as the **Central Catchment Area**, is a designated [planning area](/wiki/Planning_Areas_of_Singapore) and one of the two main water catchments of Singapore. The country's main reservoirs—[MacRitchie](/wiki/MacRitchie_Reservoir), [Upper Seletar](/wiki/Upper_Seletar_Reservoir), [Upper Peirce](/wiki/Upper_Peirce_Reservoir), and [Lower Peirce](/wiki/Lower_Peirce_Reservoir)—are in the central catchment area. The Central Water Catchment lies in the geographical centre of the city and is largely home to the [Central Catchment Nature Reserve](/wiki/Central_Catchment_Nature_Reserve), which houses several other recreational sites, including the [Singapore Zoo](/wiki/Singapore_Zoo), the [Night Safari](/wiki/Night_Safari,_Singapore), and the [River Safari](/wiki/River_Safari). ## Wildlife MacRitchie Reservoir has resident animals such as [birds](/wiki/List_of_birds_of_Singapore), monkeys, and [monitor lizards](/wiki/Monitor_lizard). The [Treetop Walk](/wiki/Central_Catchment_Nature_Reserve#HSBC_TreeTop_Walk), a one-way suspension bridge, is a popular attraction for birdwatchers and tourists.[*citation needed*] The monkeys at MacRitchie Reservoir are infamous for attacking people out of aggression and in search of food. These attacks have occasionally led to injuries among visitors. The National Parks Board has put up signs all over the reservoir, instructing people on what to do when they encounter monkeys.[*citation needed*] Birds such as the [white-bellied sea eagle](/wiki/White-bellied_sea_eagle) can be found in the Upper Seletar Reservoir.
title: Central Water Catchment
